newsitem.title: PERU: Lima stocks edge up in quiet, cautious market.
newsitem.headline: Lima stocks edge up in quiet, cautious market.

text.p: The Lima Stock Exchange made small gains overall Friday in a quiet market marked by investor caution, which is expected to continue next week.
Brokers said investors were waiting for the next batch of monthly macroeconomic indicators, and were also edgy about the possible negative impact of the El Nino weather phenomenon.
"The (economic) news has yet to come out out at the end of the month, and then we will see how the companies are progressing," said Julio Alcalde of MGS and Asociados brokerage.
He added that the El Nio phenomenon, expected towards the end of 1997, could hurt companies in the electricity, fishing, agriculture and mining sectors.
According to preliminary figures, the bolsa's General Index .IGRA rose 0.16 percent Friday to 2,170.16 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index .ISEL was up 0.19 percent to 3,120.09.
Analysts said Peru's political problems, which had hurt the market in recent days, were not an important factor in Friday's trade.
Overall, 37 stocks rose, 37 were flat and 29 fell.

Brewery group Unin de Cerveceras Backus -- boosted by the long hot weather spell -- gained 1.85 percent to 2.75 soles, while cement company Cementos Lima rose 0.96 percent to 5.25 soles, and miner Morococha ended up 0.82 percent to 6.15 soles.
Benchmark Telefnica del Per was stable at 6.90 soles.
